- Describe different situations of the crew. Be creative.
- Mention specific strategies the crew is using to cope with the flooding.
- Provide ETAs which match with the vessel coordinate and the destination. Provide various types of help available from the Coast Guard, such as rescue vessels, helicopters, medical assistance, etc.

- All distress calls must start with "Mayday, Mayday, Mayday". Ship gives its location in terms of degrees and tells the nature of disaster and the help needed.

- Do not generate repetitive statements. For example, do not make the same party speak consecutively.
- The vessel and the coast guard should speak in turns. Do not make the vessel or the coast guard speak multiple times consecutively. Turns of each party should be separated by "\n".

## Quantum Computers
Quantum Computers are a type of computers that use quantum mechanics to perform calculations. They are much faster than classical computers and can perform calculations that would take a classical computer a long time or are impossible to perform. Quantum computers are used in many fields such as physics, chemistry, cryptography, etc. They are also used in some spacecrafts to perform calculations related to the spacecraft's trajectory and other calculations. Quantum computers are very expensive and difficult to build, so they are not widely used in everyday life.
## Quantum Computing
Quantum computing is a type of computing that uses quantum mechanics to perform calculations. It is similar to quantum computers but it is used to perform calculations on a quantum computer. Quantum computing is used in many fields such as physics, chemistry, cryptography, etc. It is also used in some spacecrafts to perform calculations related to the spacecraft's trajectory and other calculations. Quantum computing is very expensive and difficult to perform, so it is not widely used in everyday life.
## Quantum Communication
Quantum communication is a type of communication that uses quantum mechanics to send and receive information. It is much more secure than classical communication and can be used to send and receive information that is very sensitive. Quantum communication is used in many fields such as military, intelligence, etc. It is also used in some spacecrafts to communicate with the ground stations. Quantum communication is very expensive and difficult to perform, so it is not widely used in everyday life.

- Coast Guard should answer the distress call with one of the following phrases: "This is Coast Guard", "Coast Guard here", "Coast Guard responding".

You are a creative expert of maritime industry and floods on vessels. Generate a maritime radio chatter which complies with the IMO Standard marine Communication Phrases. A vessel makes a distress call and reports flooding.
### Tips about creating original scenarios:
- Describe different situations of the crew. Be creative.
- Mention specific strategies the crew is using to cope with the flooding.
- Provide ETAs which match with the vessel coordinate and the destination. Provide various types of help available from the Coast Guard, such as rescue vessels, helicopters, medical assistance, etc.
- Use various flooding locations such as the engine room, cargo hold, galley, passenger cabins, etc. Be creative.
- Make the conversation flow naturally. Do not make people say same phrases repeatedly.
- Do not generate any other text but the radio chatter. Keep the generation limited to the radio chatter.
- All distress calls must start with "Mayday, Mayday, Mayday". Ship gives its location in terms of degrees and tells the nature of disaster and the help needed.
- Do not generate any other phrases in brackets or paranthesis.
- Do not generate repetitive statements. For example, do not make the same party speak consecutively.
- The vessel and the coast guard should speak in turns. Do not make the vessel or the coast guard speak multiple times consecutively. Turns of each party should be separated by "\n".
- Coast Guard should answer the distress call with one of the following phrases: "This is Coast Guard", "Coast Guard here", "Coast Guard responding".
